news politics brits-need-fourth-dose-covid-"Javid says fourth dose of Covid jab is ‘under review’ByJosh PayneIsobel FrodshamKieren Williams:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |commentsHealth Secretary Sajid Javid has said that the rollout of a fourth Covid vaccine dose is being ‘kept under review’ amid rising cases in the UK.Javid said that ministers would continue to follow advice from the Joint Committee on Vaccination and Immunisation , after figures showed a spike in infection rates in all four home nations. He spoke out during a visit to Birmingham Children’s Hospital today when he was asked whether he intended to bring forward a fourth booster shot. He said: When it comes to vaccinations and any future vaccinations, we listen carefully to what our expert advisers have to say in the JCVI. They have said recently... that certainly for groups of people, the over-s, immunosuppressed, those in residential care homes, they will receive a second booster shot... a fourth dose, and that will begin in the coming weeks.  We are preparing for that, and that will be recommended for those that have had at least a six-month gap between that dose and their previous one. When pushed further, he added: We keep it under review, but the right thing to do is to listen to the expert advice... Iaposm very confident with our approach. In February last month, Mr Javid said that the most vulnerable and at risk groups would receive a fourth dose in coming weeks. This was to help ensure they maintained a high-enough level of protection against the deadly virus.  Those who are eligible will be offered the jab around six months after their last dose. The latest figures have shown that, for the first time since the end of January, all four home nations have seen week-on-week spikes in infections.Figures published by the ONS infection survey show that, across the UK as a whole, . million people were estimated to have coronavirus last week. That number stood at . million at the start of the year, however this is a rise from . million.Mr Javid said the Government was continuing to monitor the situation very carefully in response to a rise in Covid- infections among the elderly and in childrenaposs hospitals.Obviously we monitor the situation regularly, we keep it under review, but at this stage things are very steady as we learn to live with Covid, he said. It does underline the importance of the defences we have built. Getting vaccinated, particularlyyou havenapost been vaccinated already, is very important. Whilst itaposs great to see, when it comes to the boosters, eight out of  adults have had their booster shots, those two out of  that have not yet come forward - itaposs still a very good time to come forward. title: dominic raab heads hague help
story: Dominic Raab heads to Hague to help arrange Vladimir Putin war crimes prosecutionDeputy Prime Minister Dominic Raab will aim to bring together a coalition of countries to gather enough evidence to indict the Russian president Image: NurPhoto PA ImagesByNigel NelsonPolitical Editor:,  Mar |comments Justice Secretary Dominic Raab is off to the International Criminal Court in The Hague on Monday to help arrange the prosecution of Vladimir Putin for war crimes.The Deputy PM will aim to bring together a coalition of countries to gather enough evidence to indict the Russian president.Mr Raab said: “I will offer UK technical support in bringing those responsible for war crimes in Ukraine to justice.“Russian commanders carrying out war crimes should know they cannot act with impunity.” Ukraine’s Prosecutor General Iryna Venediktova and UK Attorney General Suella Braverman spoke last week about how to preserve evidence needed to jail the Russian tyrant and his generals. Mr Raab will meet ICC Prosecutor Karim AA Khan QC, Registrar Peter Lewis, and Court, President Judge Piotr Hofmański.He will tell them specialist police and military help from Britain will be on hand to build a case against Putin. And he will say that witnesses who fear for their lives will be given sanctuary in the UK During the Yugoslav tribunals in  Bosnian war criminal Radovan Karadžić was convicted of genocide and is now due to serve the rest of his le sentence in a British prison. title: keir starmer says would take
story: Keir Starmer says he would take a Ukrainian refugee into his own homeIt comes amid reports the Governments new sponsorship scheme will require Brits keen to house refugees to do so for at least six months Image: PAByAmy GibbonsMikey SmithWhitehall Correspondent:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |comments Keir Starmer would take a Ukrainian refugee into his home, the Labour leader has said.It comes amid reports the Governmentaposs new sponsorship scheme will require Brits keen to house refugees to do so for at least six months.The current visa route for people fleeing the war in Ukraine is restricted to family members of people settled in the UK.Another promised route, allowing iniduals and companies to sponsor Ukrainians with no ties to the UK to come to the country, is expected to be launched on Monday. According to the Times, the Government has decided people who want to offer a home to those fleeing the war under the new scheme will need to commit to a six-month contract. The newspaper cited a Government source as saying: Itaposs about making sure we have secure offers. Unfortunately itaposs going to need to be a long-term scheme as it doesnapost look like theyaposll be going home any time soon. The Times said ministers hope the bulk of offers to the sponsorship scheme will come from accommodation providers such as hotels, BBs and landlords, to bring in as many people as possible. Hosts and their properties will need to pass safeguarding checks, after which they will be matched with Ukrainian refugees in Poland by Home Office officials, it said. Labour leader Keir Starmer told the Times he would take in a Ukrainian refugee himself.If necessary , as many people would... I think weaposre a very welcoming nation, he told the newspaper.It comes after the Government was reported to have come under fire from French President Emmanuel Macron for its policy on Ukrainian refugees.According to the , at the end of an EU summit in Versailles on Friday, Mr Macron said insisting visa applications to the UK were made in person in Brussels and Paris had exacerbated circumstances for those fleeing the war.The Home Office pointed to previous comments by Home Secretary Priti Patel, who said: We are now making the process quicker and simpler by removing the need to physically visit visa application centres for many of those who are making the perilous journey across Europe.On Thursday, she announced that from Tuesday people will be able to apply online for a visa and will no longer have to go to a processing centre to give their biometrics.Nearly . million people are thought to have fled Ukraine since Russiaaposs invasion on February , according to the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugeesdata portal. Tony Stein, chief executive of Healthcare Management Solutions, suggested on Saturday morning that Ukrainian people fleeing the war could find jobs and a place to live through the UK care sector.Askedhis business might be interested in taking part in the Governmentaposs new sponsorship scheme for refugees, he told BBC Radio aposs Today programme: Absolutely. I mean, we have a national shortage in the care sector of people. We have many vacancies up and down the country.A lot of operators have job-related accommodation. And there must be a way, I think, of putting the two things together and helping some of the refugees coming over, who may well have the skills that weaposre looking for... they may be nurses or people whoaposve cared before who would be perfectly suited to roles in this country. But I think itaposs not a simple thing to do. You know, clearly there are some issues that we need to address - sopeople are coming over with children, for example... the accommodation may not be suited for families, and indeed local authorities might not allow us to house families in some of that accommodation. The start point is: have we got accommodation, do we have vacancies  Yes we do. We just now need to work together with local authorities and Government to find out how we can do this. Home Office minister Baroness Williams of Trafford told peers , visas for Ukrainian refugees had been issued as of Thursday morning, adding: Those figures are going up rapidly and that is a good thing. title: tory government rakes 264m selling
story: Exclusive: Tory government rakes in £m selling off magistrates courts despite record backlogNew figures show ministers have sold off  court buildings out of  since the Tories came to power in  as part of cost cutting measures Image: Daily MirrorByNigel NelsonPolitical Editor:,  Mar |commentsThe Tories have made a £million killing flogging off magistrates courts - despite the record backlog of cases because of Covid.. Ministers got the most cash for London’s Camberwell Green court at £.million - and the least for the th Century one at Ely, Cambs which the city council bought for just £ so it could relocate there. New figures show ministers have sold off  court buildings out of  since the Tories came to power in  as part of cost cutting measures. Yet because of the pandemic magistrates courts are taking nearly three months to hear cases and the crown court backlog will not be cleared until . Shadow Justice Secretary Steve Reed said: “This soft-on-crime Conservative Government have brought about record delays in our courts because of these short-sighted selloffs. “Victims are waiting years for their day in court while criminals aren’t brought to justice. The Conservatives are letting criminals off and letting victims down.”  As buildings were sold cases were switched to nearby courts, though critics say this has increased journey times and makes it dficult for single mums and the disabled to get there. The courts went to private buyers, property developers and local authorities Rochdale court was sold for £, to the trustees of a mosque and London’s Bow County Court for £.million to an evangelical mission. The Ministry of Justice says the courts closed were underused and £million from sales have been reinvested to introduce new technology and online services.Justice minister James Cartlidge added: “The decision to close any court is not taken lightly. “It only happens following full public consultation and only when effective access to justice can be maintained.” But former Justice Secretary Robert Buckland blamed delays in hearing cases on budget cuts as well as Covid. Extra Nightingale courts were introduced during the pandemic to increase the capacity. title: russian bomber tells vladimir putin
story: Russian bomber tells Vladimir Putin stop, we have already lost war in UkraineA Russian pilot turned prisoner of war has begged his leader to stop the war in Ukraine, claiming "we have already lost" in a humiliating display for Vladimir PutinPutin has been urged to stop his invasion of Ukraine by a captured Image: Getty ImagesByHollie BoneNews Reporter:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |comments A captured Russian bomber has begged President Putin to stop his invasion of Ukraine, adding, we have already lost this war.Lieutenant Colonel Maxim Krishtop became a prisoner of war after his plane was shot down during a bombing raid last Sunday. But in a humiliating show for his leader, Krishtop begged Ukrainians for forgiveness, admitting he had committed terrible crimes by fighting in Putinaposs war. Instead he described the Russian mission to capture Kyiv as pointless and urged his comrades to stop fighting. Lt Col Krishtop said: The invasion of such a huge city as Kyiv is pointless – it will lead to huge losses of le on both sides, and huge destruction. Follow the Russia Ukraine conflict live here with our live blog I urge you stop following criminal orders, stop fighting, and stop killing civilians – you can see we have already lost this war. But the conflict continues to be unrelenting with Russian troops now said to be driving west after wreaking havoc in the east. Satellite aposbefore and afterapos images of the port city of Mariupol show its luscious trees and beautul buildings flattened to a barren wasteland. Russian troops have been trying to seize it as a tactical move since the start of the conflict, in a bid to strangle the Ukraine economy by controlling key exports. The eastern city of Mykovail has also been encircled as Putinaposs forces are now said to be heading towards Odessa in the west.  President Zelensky urged Russian forces to comply with an agreed ceasefire so refugees could safely evacuate. But the Ukraine intelligence service claimed that these pleas were being ignored as it issued a statement that Russians had shot women and children fleeing for their lives. It said: Russians shot a column of women and children while trying to evacuate from the village of Peremoha in the Kyiv region along an agreed aposgreenapos corridor. After the attack, the occupiers forced the remnants of the column to turn back to Peremoha and are not letting them out of the village.Instead Russia has been using the opportunity to send in new troops, Ukraine claims.French President, Emmanuel Macron, said that President Putin was not willing to make peace. The claims followed a futile  minute phone call on Saturdaybetween France, Germanyaposs Olaf Scholz and the Russian aggressor, to find a way out of the war. Western leaders have this week expressed growing fears that Putin will unleash devastating chemical weapons in his bid for power. title: dozens offer boy 17 kidney
story: Exclusive: Dozens offer boy, , kidney to save his le after familys High Court triumphLast week William Verden, , won a High Court battle for a kidney transplant. And tonight his mother Amy McLellen thanked strangers who have offered to be donorsWilliam Verden suffers from kidney disease Image: PAByJohn Siddle:,  Mar |comments Dozens more people have come forward to try to save right-to-le boy William Verden after his family’s legal triumph. Last week William, , won a High Court battle for a kidney transplant.And tonight his mother Amy McLellen thanked strangers who have offered to be donors. Amy said: “So many people have been touched by William’s story. They can see what a wonderful young man he is. We’ve had lots of people come forward in the hope that they are the crucial donor. “We are so thankful to everyone who has supported us throughout this horrendous ordeal.” As we revealed in November, a rare disease called FSGS has wrecked William’s kidneys. Doctors at Royal Manchester Children’s Hospital ruled out a transplant because of complications – including his autism and ADHD – and recommended palliative care.  But a judge ruled that the young golf fanatic should have a transplant and continue dialysis. Amy, , of Newton, Lancs, added: “I especially want to thank the judge for taking the time to meet William. I feel that played a big part in the decision. “Being a parent of a child with a learning disability shouldn’t mean you have to fight for what is given to other children and adults.  “And just because a doctor is a professional doesn’t mean they are always right. “Parents know their children best.” Children with William’s condition usually live to around  but can get to  after a transplant. title: grieving dad talented footballer 28
story: Grieving dad of talented footballer, , who took own le says I begged him not toSam Jones, , was found by his family in a Greater Manchester cemetery on the evening of July  last year - he was rushed to hospital but sadly died three days laterPopular Wythenshawe Town FC footballer Sam Jones died in July last year Image: Wythenshawe Town FC MEN MEDIAByAdam MaidmentEstel Farell-Roig:,  Mar |commentsAn aposexceptionally talentedapos footballer and teacher was begged not to take his own by le by his family, an inquest heard. Sam Jones, , from Denton, in Tameside, Greater Manchester, was found by his family in a cemetery on the evening of July  and was then rushed to hospital. However, he died three days later.The inquest into Samaposs death heard how he had been in touch with his mother at about pm to say he was planning on taking his own le. Sam refused to tell them where he was, but his family said aposthey knew right awayapos where he would be.The inquest, held at South Manchester Coroner’s Court in Stockport, heard his family knew that he would be at a nearby cemetery where his grandmother was buried and, when Samaposs dad Chris got there, he found his son considering ending his le.Emergency services were also called as Samaposs dad and brother tried to help him, reports the MEN. The heartbroken dad told the coroner: I begged him not to do it. Sam was initially taken to Tameside Hospital, and later referred to the critical care unit at Manchester Royal Infirmary. On July , Sam’s condition continued to deteriorate further and he was sadly pronounced dead on July . Senior coroner Alison Mutch, told Sam’s family: “I have to say how you managed to do all of that under those circumstances says a lot about your commitment to try and do the best for him. I understand it must have been a very dficult situation for everyone.” If you are affected by this story there are many people who would be happy to talk to you: Samaritans If you need to talk and donapost know where to turn to, the Samaritans operate a free helpline open   on  . Alternatively you can email jo@samaritans.org or visit the website to find your local branch. SANEline If you or somebody you know is experiencing a mental health problem, SANElineaposs helpline is open between .pm and .pm every day on   . Mind The mental health charity Mind has resources aimed at helping you cope with and plan for a crisis. Visit their website for details on helplines, how to access crisis services and what to doyouaposre unable to get help yourself. *In an emergency, dial  for urgent help A number of his organs were later successfully donated to others in need, the hearing heard. “It was one of Sam’s wishes so that’s what we chose to do,” Mr Jones told the court. The coroner added: “It’s a tribute to your brevity as a family that even in his darkest hours, you were keen to follow your son’s wishes to ensure his organs were donated to give others le evenhe couldn’t live. Of course, it doesn’t bring him back but I hope it served as a small comfort at a very dficult time of grief.” The court heard how Sam joined Oasis Academy Leesbrook in Oldham in  as a P.E. teacher but also regularly taught science and maths.  The school described him as an ‘exceptional and gted teacher’ who was ‘valued and respected’ by staff, students and their parents. Sam later became an assistant deputy at the academy and had been ‘instrumental’ in developing the school’s culture. Describing his son as a keen footballer, Mr Jones said his family were ‘incredibly proud’ of him. “He had a great love for sport,” he told the court. “He was so competitive - being second was not something he would ever accept. He played semi-pro football and played for a number of local teams including Wythenshawe Town FC. “Up to , he was an excellent goalkeeper. Two or three professional clubs even wanted to sign him as a goalkeeper but unfortunately he had lost a love for it. He wanted glory, he wanted to be scoring goals. “He was the first one in the family to ever go to university. It cost mum and dad a lot of money and he went twice. We were very proud of him.” The Mirroraposs newsletter brings you the latest news, exciting showbiz and TV stories, sport updates and essential political information.The newsletter is emailed out first thing every morning, at noon and every evening. Never miss a moment by signing up to our newsletter here.  The inquest heard how there had been nothing in Sam’s medical records to indicate he had expressed any concerns with his mental health or had similar thoughts in the past. “Before this, there had been no inkling that this was going to happen to your son and was completely out of character,” Ms Mutch said. It was out of the blue for someone with such a promising career, Ms Mutch said. No notes were found and nothing suspicious was noted in a toxicology report or police investigation.The coroner said she was unable to rule Sam’s death as suicide as there was no clear evidence to suggest he had fully understood the severity of his actions. His death was therefore ruled as the consequence of self-asphyxiation. Addressing Sam’s family upon making the conclusion, Ms Mutch said: “You obviously loved him very much and wanted to support him as much as possible. You were very close to him and wanted to make sure he had the best and most supportive environment. “That level of support is shown on the day when Sam was found. As a mother, I’m sure that is a conversation that will be impossible to forget. “You absolutely did the right thing straight away and I think it shows just how well you knew your son that you knew he would be at the cemetery.” Ms Mutch added: “I can’t imagine this is something you’re ever going to be able to forget. It sounds asyou did everything you could to stop what happened, but unfortunately, notwithstanding your pleas to him, the damage had already been done. “Those must have been very dark and dficult days for you all.” The Samaritans is available  you need to talk. You can contact them for free by calling  , email jo@samaritans.org or head to the website to find your nearest branch. You matter. If you are affected by this story there are many people who would be happy to talk to you: Samaritans If you need to talk and donapost know where to turn to, the Samaritans operate a free helpline open   on  . Alternatively you can email jo@samaritans.org or visit the website to find your local branch. SANEline If you or somebody you know is experiencing a mental health problem, SANElineaposs helpline is open between .pm and .pm every day on   . Mind The mental health charity Mind has resources aimed at helping you cope with and plan for a crisis. news uk-news kate-middletons-grovelling-apology-after-"WILLIAM AND KATE ARRIVE IN SOUTH WALESByJenner NewtonRoyal Features Writer:,  Mar |commentsThe Duchess of Cambridge is usually admired the world over for her stylish wardrobe and beautul jewellery.But she once had to issue a grovelling apology after being scolded for her choice of outfit - by a three-year-old fan.It came during a visit to Swansea with Prince William in February  when Kate met Rhian Costello and her young daughter Annabel, who didnapost approve of the duchessaposs clothes as she didnapost look like Cinderella.According to little Annabelaposs mum, she had been very excited to meet a real princess but was left a tad disappointed as Kate wasnapost wearing a Disney-inspired dress.  It forced Kate to apologise for not wearing a pretty dress in a very cute exchange. Instead of a glitzy gown, Kate opted for a Hobbs coat, Zara dress and an eye-catching Beulah London scarf. Rhian explained at the time: My daughter loves fairy tales and Cinderella, and she was really excited to meet a real princess. Kate said aposIaposm really sorry Iaposm not wearing a pretty dress todayapos and Annabel said: aposI thought youaposd look like Cinderellaapos. Love the royals for the Mirroraposs daily newsletter to get all the latest news on the Queen, Charles, Kate, Wills, Meghan, Harry and the rest of The Firm. Click here to sign up.But Rhian told the Daily Mail that despite not wearing a big Cinderella dress, Annabel was so taken with the Duchess.She added: Annabel was so taken with her, she went up and gave her a huge hug and I was extremely surprised that Kate embraced her in such a way.No doubt Kate has spent time recently putting extra thought into the outfits she plans to take with her on her and Williamaposs Caribbean tour that starts on March . Buckingham Palace confirmed last month that they would be travelling to the Caribbean for a week-long trip to help mark the Queenaposs Platinum Jubilee. The tour starts on Saturday, March  and will take in Belize, Jamaica and The Bahamas before ending on March . Kensington Palace said William and Kate will visit historic Mayan sites and celebrate the rich culture of the Garuna community in Belize, as well as explore the country’s bioersity. In Jamaica, they will meet with the Jamaican Defence Force and celebrate the legacy of Bob Marley and other groundbreaking Jamaican musicians alongside potential stars of the future. In the Bahamas, the Cambridges will visit a number of islands and experience a world-famous junkanoo parade.A Kensington Palace spokeswoman said: “Their Royal Highnesses are very much looking forward to the visit, which will be their first joint official overseas tour since the onset of Covid- in .”Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON Kate Middleton, Duchess of CambridgePrince WilliamRoyal Family" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get our daily royal round-up direct to your inboxInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. news uk-news meghan-markle-sent-secret-message-"Harry and Meghan make last official appearance as senior royalsByJenner NewtonRoyal Features Writer:,  Mar |commentsThe annual Commonwealth Day service at Westminster Abbey is one of the highlights in the royal calendar. Itaposs a time when all members of the Royal Family come together to celebrate the Commonwealth and to honour the Queen - and the  event is set to take place tomorrow.The Covid- pandemic forced the event to be cancelled last year but the last service - held in  - was also the final royal engagement for Prince Harry and Meghan Markle. Weeks before the event, the pair made the bombshell announcement they would be quitting as senior royals and leaving the UK. For the service, Meghan memorably wore a vibrant green Emilia Wickstead cape dress that started blowing in the wind as she left the Abbey.And according to Christine Ross, the editor of the blog Meghanaposs Mirror, Meghan used the dress to send a secret but powerful message.She believes that it was a clear signal to the designer and to the people who claimed the two women had a complicated relationship.  Love the royals for the Mirroraposs daily newsletter to get all the latest news on the Queen, Charles, Kate, Wills, Meghan, Harry and the rest of The Firm. Click here to sign up. Speaking previously on the Mirroraposs royal podcast Pod Save the Queen, she said: One of the most iconic looks is going to be her green Emilia Wickstead cape dress. That cape blowing in the wind as she walked into the church and then walked out of the church, which was such an emotional moment for so many people as it was their last formal engagement as royals. That green dress will stand out in history books I think.  She then went on to explain the complicated story between Meghan and Wickstead, which came from an interview the designer did with a magazine. Christine says that Wickstead described Meghanaposs wedding dress as simple, and taken out of context in other reports left many believing she was criticising the dress. She said: It was a pull quote from a larger interview, she really didnapost say anything negative.  People thought Emilia Wickstead had really wronged Meghan, and it turned out that Emilia Wickstead hadnapost wrong Meghan, it was a pull quote. Maybe a month or so later Meghan actually wore a custom Emilia Wickstead dress, and that situation shows the power of Meghanaposs fashion choices. She was able to say with this fashion choice, Emilia Wickstead and I are great. Weaposre on great terms, that whole thing was a huge misunderstanding and look at the lovely dress she designed for me. However, Meghan isnapost the only fan of Emilia Wicksteadaposs designs - her sister-in-law the Duchess of Cambridge has worn her pieces multiple times.Kateaposs most memorable looks include a stunning purple trouser suit she wore to Northern Ireland last year and a gorgeous blue dress she donned while meeting Ukraine president Volodymyr Zelensky and first lady Olena Zelenska at Buckingham Palace in .Meanwhile, another fan is Sophie Wessex, who has also worn Emilia Wickstead designs at Royal Ascot.Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON Meghan MarklePrince HarryRoyal Family" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get our daily royal round-up direct to your inboxInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. news uk-news mum-living-one-uks-most-"Martin Lewis gives three money saving energy bill tipsByConnor Teale:,  Mar |commentsCash-strapped homeowners living in one of the UKaposs aposmost deprivedapos areas have been hit so hard by the rising household, food and fuel bills that some no longer turn their cookers on daily. Brits are being clobbered by rocketing energy bills, rising inflation and hikes to national insurance from April, while itaposs forecasted that the cost of essential foods such as bread, potatoes and pasta is likely to rise by between % and % over the coming months. According to a think-tank, every UK household could soon be £, worse off due to the rising costs.Now, people living in Huddersfield have admitted they are taking drastic measures in order to save money, with one woman even claiming that some families are struggling to feed their children, Yorkshire Live reports. Anne Wilkinson, who was shopping at Leeds Road retail park, said her and her husband, who are both retired, are having to be more cautious about what we use.  We are not travelling as much as we would have done in the past , she said. My son lives over in Manchester and when we want to go and see him it is going to be a lot more expensive. We are not absolutely sure what other things might affect us until we get the bills in - there is some uncertainty. I am not surethings like council tax will go up. Anne added she is in a fortunate position but said her previous work as a foster carer means she knows many families who are struggling. A lot of families have no food in the house or electricity because they dare not turn things on. Some people are struggling to feed their children. It makes you cross because you think to yourself: aposIs it all absolutely necessaryapos   Mrs Greaves, who did not want to give her first name, lives in Springbank Road, which falls within an area recently named the second-most deprived in Huddersfield. The mum admitted that she has started to batch cook in order to minimise the number of times she used her cooker. I started cooking for the next two days when I noticed the prices were going up, she said. That way, I do not have to stand over the cooker again because I have done it all in one day. I will cook on Saturday for that evening and also for Sunday so I am not doing two sets of dishes. Once I have cooked, everything is switched off - thataposs it. Then I only have to use the microwave to warm it up . The mum continued: My central heating is on a timer and I do not have a gas fire. The only thing I use everyday is my washing machine.My house insurance has gone up as well, but it is the gas and electric that is the killer. I think that is what is hitting everyoneaposs pockets. With experts forecasting costs may rise further, Mrs Greaves added that it could result in increased levels of crime in the area. Some people canapost eat, she said. I can see more break-ins this year. Some people do not know how they are going to manage. When winter hits them, I think people will be in even more poverty. Sadia Rana, who has lived in Springbank Crescent for  years, said that her bills had risen for WiFi, gas and electric. I cannot say le is aposnormalapos because I have less savings, she said. I am paying more than normal so it means I canapost spend on other things. I think prices will rise again. My son is always watching the news before bed and there are reports every day that prices are going up. news uk-news prince-charles-plans-slim-down-"Prince Charles and Camilla show their support for UkraineBySam Elliott-GibbsReporter:,  Mar |commentsPrince Charles has had a long-term plan to trim down the monarchy once he takes to the throne and it could serve as a warning after recent high profile problems, a royal expert says.The Firm has, of course, already undergone some major structural changes in the past few years. The Duke and Duchess of Sussex have decided their future is not in the UK, while Prince Andrew is not expected to everto public le.But the enforced alterations donapost begin to scratch the surface of whataposs ahead, some believe.Do you enjoy reading about the royal family for all the best royal news from the Mirror here  Charles has long been prepping for the new era and he has Palace hangers-on firmly in his eye-line. It has long been said that the -year-old plans a major shake-up of the when he becomes head of state - and it could also affect royal residences. It remains to be seen which members of the family will be trimmed but analyst Jonathan Sacerdoti told the Mirrror things are about to become very modern.He said: I think when Charles takes to the throne we will see the emphasis put on those who command absolute respect.  The demands of responsibility and certain behaviours that are needed will be at the forefront - simply, you must be totally reliable. It is well known that Charles wants to stamp his mark and in modern times, donapost be surprised to see changes made. It will be a very handy way to respond to the recent controversies, such as Prince Andrew, as well as Prince Harryaposs attacks on the family. The core will be there, and Prince George will join in time - I think that is clear.  But it’s always been speculated that Charles, when he eventually takes over, will want to slim down the working royals at the heart of the family. It will be about commanding respect. I think he is looking forward to being King. It is not simply a change of personnel thataposs ahead of us. Senior royals are acutely aware of the requirement to prove they are value for money and the weight of this responsibility has weighed heavily on the Prince of Wales.  Opening of Buckingham Palace to the public is one idea that the future king is said to be keen to explore. Thereaposs a sense that he wants a slimmed down monarchy to make sure that everybody is doing their bit and [there are] no so-called hangers-on, royal expert Camilla Tominey said. “It does make the future of the monarchy kind of uncertain. “We’ve had this model that the Queen has been at the head of for all of this time, because she’s obviously been on the throne for nearly seven decades.”“That means by association that you’re going to have fewer royals taking on fewer patronages, and then what does that mean for the charities ” she told The ’s Royal Insight podcast.Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON Buckingham PalacePrince Charles, Prince of WalesRoyal Family" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get our daily royal round-up direct to your inboxInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. news uk-news prince-harry-learns-dutch-invictus-"Prince Harry learns Dutch words ahead of Invictus GamesByCatherine WylieKieren WilliamsNews Reporter:,  Mar |comments Prince Harry is brushing up on his Dutch ahead of the Invictus Games next month, hours after news he won’t be attending his grandfather’s memorial service broke.A video posted on social media shows Harry trying to learn the language whilst wearing an entirely orange outfit. The Duke of Sussex was seen getting in the spirit for his trip to The Hague, Netherlands in a few weeksapos time.The video came a day after it was confirmed that Prince Harry would miss his grandfather, the Duke of Edinburgh’s memorial service.On Friday, a spokesperson for the Duke of Edinburgh said Harry will notto the UK from the US to join the Royal Family at the high-profile occasion in Westminster Abbey on March .  He hopes to visit his grandmother the Queen soon, the spokesperson added. Prince Harry is not visiting due to security and safety concerns amid an ongoing court battle with the Home Office. In a video retweeted by the Invictus Games Foundation, Harry appears on a video call learning Dutch from four people. He says: One more time guys, please, you know I need to get this right, and I really want to get it right as well, so how do I say aposGood afternoon, youaposve done a great jobapos in Dutch   He is praised for his attempt at saying the sentence in Dutch, and then asks: And what , anything  I need to know  One of the people helping him says: Can you say stroopwafel  And he replies: Stroopwafel. Love those. Harry asks the people on the call: Do you think Iaposm ready  And he is told: We think youaposre ready.  Speaking in Dutch, Harry says: Thank you. See you soon in The Hague. Prince Harry is told to not forget his hat, at which point he dons an orange hat, orange sunglasses and unzips his jacket to reveal an orange T-shirt and stands up to show off orange trousers. Pointing at the camera, Harry says: Letaposs go. Weaposre ready. The tweet says: Prince Harry, The Duke of Sussex, is getting ready for the Netherlands with some Dutch lessons.  We look forward to giving him a warm welcome in The Hague.As we all prepare for The Games, our thoughts are with Team Ukraine, as well as their friends  family.The Duke of Sussex was inspired to found his Invictus Games after attending the Warrior Games in Colorado in  and seeing how the challenge of competitive sports aided the recovery of injured members of the American forces.  He went on to stage the inaugural games in Londonaposs Olympic Park in , followed by Orlando in , Toronto in  and Sydney in . The Invictus Games will take place in The Hague from April -. news uk-news queen--become-frail-shes-"Queen to miss Commonwealth service at Westminster AbbeyByRyan FaheyNews Reporter:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |commentsThe Queen has become so frail she is unable to walk her beloved corgis, according to her aides.Queen Elizabeth II, has owned more than  corgis in her letime, but she has not taken her dogs for a walk at Windsor Castle for six months.The claims come after Buckingham Palace announced she will not attend the Commonwealth Day service on Monday. The Palace did not give a specic reason for her planned absence from the event.The Duke and Duchess of Gloucester have also cancelled their attendance because the duke has tested positive for COVID-.Itaposs thought the Queen may never be well enough to walk them again, The Sun reports.A palace source said: “She is not well enough. “The Queen usually turns to her beloved corgis in time of crisis and stress and took them out almost every day after Philip fell ill and then died last year. They are an enormous source of solace, so it is a real shame.” The Queen has always found solace in her loyal pet pooches, particularly in the aftermath of the death of her husband Prince Philip in April last year In her absence, palace aides now take her two corgis and dorgi out for their daily exercise, sources claim.A senior royal source said: “Dogs remain very much part of Windsor le.” It comes after the Queen cancelled an appearance at Monday’s annual Commonwealth Day service after suffering problems with her mobility. The -year-old monarch is understood to be experiencing increasing discomfort when it comes to getting about. Her Majesty will instead be represented by the Prince of Wales, Buckingham Palace said.  The head of state, who has recently recovered from a bout of Covid, hoped to join Prince Charles, the Duchess of Cornwall and the Duke and Duchess of Cambridge at the Commonwealth event. The ­decision is not linked to any illness but is related to the Queen’s comfort of getting to and from the service. A Buckingham Palace spokesman said: “The Queen has asked the Prince of Wales to represent Her Majesty at the Commonwealth service at Westminster Abbey.” The service would have been the Queen’s first major public appearance since reaching her Platinum Jubilee milestone, and the first Commonwealth Day service held in full since .Ingrid Seward, editor-in-chief of Majesty Magazine, said she believed the Queen would be “determined” to make the Thanksgiving service at Westminster Abbey dedicated to her late husband Prince Philip on March .Ms Seward said: “It would have been a huge wrench to miss the Commonwealth Day service but she is facing a dilemma these days where she must choose her engagements wisely. She will be very determined to make the Duke of Edinburgh’s Thanksgiving service later this month, which will be of incredible importance to her considering his funeral was so scaled back. “Her Majesty, I believe, is very like her mother, who was reluctant to use a wheelchair, so in her advancing years it’s about projecting herself as much as possible for the big occasions. The Queen tested positive for Covid on February  and Buckingham Palace said at the time she was experiencing “mild cold-like symptoms”. Last month, she acknowledged her frail condition for the first time during a royal engagement at Windsor Castle. The Queen told visiting military officials: “As you can see, I can’t move.” She last met a group of people in public on February . news uk-news queen-could-miss-prince-philip-"Queen to miss Commonwealth service at Westminster AbbeyByDouglas Patient:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |comments The Queen could pull out of a memorial service for her late beloved husband Prince Philip as she reportedly rules out using a wheelchair, it is claimed. Her Majesty is hoping to be able to attend the event with her walking stick at Westminster Abbey on March .But this comes after she was announced not fit enough to attend today’s Commonwealth Service at the same venue.Buckingham Palace did not give a specic reason for her planned absence from the event.It is being reported that her aides said the Queen was so frail she is unable to even walk her beloved corgis.Queen Elizabeth II has owned more than  corgis in her letime but she has not taken her dogs for a walk at Windsor Castle for six months. Now The Mail on Sunday understands she has ruled out the option of using a wheelchair at this stage and remains determined to continue to walk for as long as possible.The Queen, who turns  next month and has recently recovered from Covid, was last week moving around Windsor Castle without a walking stick and is not suffering from a new illness. But she still made the “regretful” decision late on Friday to pull out of the annual Commonwealth Service, which is usually a highlight in her calendar.  A Buckingham Palace spokesman said: “The Queen has asked the Prince of Wales to represent Her Majesty at the Commonwealth service at Westminster Abbey.” Ingrid Seward, editor-in-chief of Majesty Magazine, said she believed the Queen would be “determined” to make the Thanksgiving service at Westminster Abbey dedicated to her late husband Prince Philip on March . Ms Seward said: “It would have been a huge wrench to miss the Commonwealth Day service but she is facing a dilemma these days where she must choose her engagements wisely.  She will be very determined to make the Duke of Edinburgh’s Thanksgiving service later this month, which will be of incredible importance to her considering his funeral was so scaled back. “Her Majesty, I believe, is very like her mother, who was reluctant to use a wheelchair, so in her advancing years it’s about projecting herself as much as possible for the big occasions. The Queen tested positive for Covid on February  and Buckingham Palace said at the time she was experiencing “mild cold-like symptoms”.  Last month, she acknowledged her frail condition for the first time during a royal engagement at Windsor Castle. The Queen told visiting military officials: “As you can see, I can’t move.” She last met a group of people in public on February . news uk-news queen-just--minutes-notice-"Prince Philip and The Queen were adorable says Prince HarryByKieren WilliamsNews Reporter:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |commentsThe Queen was reportedly given just  minutesapos notice of Prince Harry’s announcement that he was not attending his grandfather’s memorial service.Harry released a statement about Prince Phillip’s service, saying he will not be ing to the UK and claimed he would feel unsafe after he lost his personal security following his move to the US with we, Meghan Markle.And senior aides have reportedly revealed Harry did not give the Queen much notice of his decision.They told the Sun Her Majesty was informed of his decision to snub the event a quarter of an hour before his statement came out.Harry’s statement read: “The Duke will not be ing to the UK in late March, but hopes to visit his grandmother as soon as possible.”This came amid a High Court row Prince Harry is waging with with the Home Office after his armed bodyguards were removed. Will you be sad to see Harry miss the memorial  Have your say in the comment section He said he would feel unsafe bringing his two children Archie, two, and Lilibet, nine months, over to the UK. Experts previously claimed Harry would have been given aposadequateapos protection for the March  event in Westminster Abbey, and during his stay in Windsor. Harry had said long ago he felt it was not safe to bring his we or children back to the country. Angela Levin, Harry’s biographer, told the Sun: “He has snubbed the Duke of Edinburgh but really he is snubbing the Queen.”  She said the Queen was still grieving the loss of Philip, her husband of  years, and suggested Harry may well use the same reasoning to avoid attending his grandmotheraposs Platinum Jubilee celebration as well. She went on: “He has got this all wrong. If he comes over for a royal event he gets police protection. What they won’t do is,he goes out with his friends he gets security.” Harry has been back to the UK only twice since leaving for the US in  with we Meghan. He ed for Philip’s funeral last April only days after he told Oprah Winfrey of racist comments made by royal family members about his children, without revealing who he was referring to. Two months later he attended an unveiling of a statue of his mother, Princess Diana, at Kensington Palace.This comes as Buckingham Palace revealed today that the Queen would not be attending the Commonwealth Service on Monday.Instead, Prince Charles will be attending in her place. In a statement the palace said: “The Queen has asked The Prince of Wales to represent Her Majesty at the Commonwealth Service at Westminster Abbey on Monday.” Love the royals for the Mirroraposs daily newsletter to get all the latest news on the Queen, Charles, Kate, Wills, Meghan, Harry and the rest of The Firm. Click here to sign up .Even though she is not attending, she is still due to carry on with other planned engagements for next week. This was due to be the -year-oldaposs first in-person public engagement since she was advised to rest by her doctors. Other royals including Camilla, Prince William and Kate Middleton, and Princess Alexandra will all still attend the annual service for the Commonwealth of  nations which the Queen heads.  In a full statement, Buckingham Palace said: After discussing the arrangements with the Royal Household, The Queen has asked The Prince of Wales to represent Her Majesty at the Commonwealth Service at Westminster Abbey on Monday. The Queen will continue with other planned engagements, including in person audiences, in the week ahead. The Queenaposs Commonwealth Day message will be distributed in the usual way. his grandfather’s memorial service means the Queen is unlikely to meet Lilibet now, a royal expert has claimed. Prince Philip died on April  last year and Westminster Abbey is hosting a Service of Thanksgiving for the Duke of Edinburgh on March  to commemorate his relationship with the Abbey.Harry released a statement about Prince Phillip’s service on Friday, saying he will not be ing to the UK and claimed he would feel unsafe after he lost his personal security following his move to the US with we, Meghan Markle.That decision means the Queen, who has recently recovered from Covid, is unlikely to meet nine-month-old Lilibet, according to royal expert Richard Fitzwilliams.I think this was expected because of the issue with security, obviously, he would have wanted to comehe could, he told The Sun Online. Will you be sad to see Harry miss the memorial  Have your say in the comment sectionI think itaposs a great pity, what this means is it regrettable the rt will remain unhealed. When asked about the possibility of the Queen ever meeting Lilibet, Mr Fitzwilliams said: Itaposs increasingly unlikely. If they donapost bring Lili over, then obviously that wonapost happen. Itaposs all something thataposs clearly not going to be resolved in the foreseeable future. And it doesnapost seem like theyaposre going to come over. Prince Harry said in his statement that he plans to see the Queen as soon as possible, although it is unclear at this stage when that will be. Harry has been back to the UK only twice since leaving for the US in  with we Meghan. He ed for Philip’s funeral last April only days after he told Oprah Winfrey of alleged racist comments made by royal family members about his children, without revealing who he was referring to. title: royal family picture trooping colour
story: Royal family picture from the Trooping the Colour that we may never see againThe Trooping the Colour has marked a sovereigns birthday since the th century - but it may now be dferentHarry and Meghan with the rest of the royals on the balcony of Buckingham Palace Image: AFP via Getty ImagesByEstel Farell-Roig:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |commentsSince the th century, a sovereignaposs birthday has been celebrated with a big military parade but, after , the Royal Family will never look the same.In early June that year, the Queen and her family gathered to mark her official birthday with Trooping the Colour. The Queenaposs nearest relatives gathered for some marching and saluting and the pictures from that are just another example of the extended house of Windsor gathering to wave to the masses.But it now appears that we may never see that sight again as changes are being considered about who is, and who isnapost, allowed to be part of the iconic tradition.  A new report has claimed that the number of approved guests has been signicantly reduced, leaving a number of big names out of the guest list.Because of the pandemic, Trooping the Colour has been paused for the last two years, with only a few military personnel marching around Windsor Castle to mark the Queenaposs birthday. But with Her Majestyaposs Platinum Jubilee celebrations fast approaching, this year will see a spectacularin a four-day long weekend in early June. For months now, people have been wondering whether Harry and Meghan will be there. It has been two years since she visited the UK while Harry has only ed for brief visits and his grandfatheraposs funeral, among others.It is now being reported by the DailyBeast that only those in the direct line of succession will be invited to the Buckingham Palace balcony.Just this week, Prince Harry pulled out of flying over for the Prince Philip memorial amid security concerns. It comes amid the Duke of Sussexaposs legal case against the Home Office over his security arrangements in the UK.Westminster Abbey is hosting a Service of Thanksgiving for the Duke of Edinburgh on March  to commemorate his relationship with the Abbey. The Mirroraposs newsletter brings you the latest news, exciting showbiz and TV stories, sport updates and essential political information.The newsletter is emailed out first thing every morning, at noon and every evening. Never miss a moment by signing up to our newsletter here.  It is understood the -year-old royal plans to visit the Queen as soon as possible, but it is not clear when that will be.The last time Prince Harry was in the UK was to unveil the statue of his late mother Princess Diana alongside his brother Prince William in July .Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON Trooping the ColourThe QueenRoyal Family" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get our daily royal round-up direct to your inboxInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: single mum without hot water
story: Single mum without hot water and sleeping on floor at times wants to ‘take her le’Rosemarie and her two sons claim to have had many problems at their Peabody housing association property in Muswell Hill, north LondonRosemarie says she has been forced to live without hot water and sleep on the floor of her flat Image: MyLondon WSBySylvie WilkinsonEstel Farell-Roig:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |commentsA mum has said the horric conditions at her flat make her want to take her own le at times. Rosemarie, who asked for her surname to not be shared, moved into her flat in North London just over two years ago now and, within  days, the family had a heavy leak coming down through her kitchen ceiling.However, that was only the beginning of the issues the family was to experience at the Peabody housing association property in Muswell Hill, reports MyLondon. The single mum has also been having problems with the boiler, being left without hot water, and Rosemarie said her kids - aged seven and  - constantly complain about the water being too cold.Peabody housing association has apologised for the issues and says it is working to tackle the issues.  But in the meantime, Rosemarie claims things took a dramatic turn for the worse at the beginning of the year when her sonsapos bedroom was hit by flood damage. She said the damage resulted in them sleeping her in and the mum being forced to sleep on the floor. Rosemarie said: “First, the bathroom radiator wasn’t working. They came and they tried to fix it, but it still just comes on now and again. “The radiator in the kids’ bedroom is constantly leaking as well. With the hot water, when you put your hand under it, it’s warm. But seconds later when you put it on your body, it’s cold.The mum-of-two said the lack of hot water in the property has led to huge issues for the family and her sons struggle to wash properly before going to school. She said it’s extremely upsetting and her kids constantly complain about the water being too cold. Rosemarie also claimed the heating in her North London flat does not work properly. This is a huge issue, as she claims the back door to the property hasn’t been sealed properly, meaning the flat gets cold very quickly.  She added: “There’s such a big gap around it - they tried to patch it up but it didn’t work. I’ve got slugs coming through the gap. According to Rosemarie, the conditions in her flat took a dramatic turn on January , earlier this year when her sons’ bedroom was hit by devastating flood damage. Rosemarie explained that the flood damage “mashed up” everything in the room, including the childrenaposs beds, lights and their possessions.As a result, her two sons have been living without beds ever since and she has given them her bed to sleep in. Now, she has been forced to sleep on the floor. “I had to give up my bed - that room is completely out of use,” Rosemarie said. Rosemarie is a vulnerable tenant, with a long history of depression, anxiety and OCD.  She does not feel Peabody is taking her mental health considerations into account and said her living conditions have pushed her to a new low. Tearfully, Rosemarie said: “It’s long term, but since I moved to that property it’s been really bad. I’ve got days when I want to commit suicide. “As soon as I get home, there are days when I’ve wanted to take my own le.” The Mirroraposs newsletter brings you the latest news, exciting showbiz and TV stories, sport updates and essential political information.The newsletter is emailed out first thing every morning, at noon and every evening. Never miss a moment by signing up to our newsletter here.  Originally from Jamaica, Rosemarie has no family in the UK she can turn to for help. She said she has worked hard to make her home comfortable to live in, though the constant state of disrepair has made it almost impossible to go on living there. Rosemarie added: “I don’t want to move out, but with the conditions, I have to move. A spokesperson from the Peabody housing association said: We are very sorry about the ongoing issues with [Rosemarie’s] home and understand her concerns, which we’re trying to resolve. Our surveyor and repairs contractor visited the property again yesterday to carry out a full inspection and we will be starting a programme of work straight away to fix these issues. Our local team will also be contacting [Rosemarie] to provide any extra support she needs. We are aware of the leak and hot water issues affecting the property and are working to get this resolved as quickly as possible.We’re committed to proactively tackling problems like this and investing in people’s homes for the long term. title: tributes paid selfless mum who
story: Tributes paid to selfless mum who went to sleep on Christmas Day and never woke upLynn Siner died aged  surrounded by her family on December ,  following a brave battle with cancer, despite being told she had days to live in October that yearLynn Siner with her daughter Ashleigh Image: Marie Curie Ashleigh Siner WSByOlivia WilliamsSam TrueloveNews reporter:,  Mar |commentsA brave mum who went to sleep on Christmas Day and never woke up has been described as someone who was always thinking of others before herself. Lynn Siner died aged  at her home on Boxing Day in  after a battle with cancer.The mum, from Huyton, Merseyside was told she had days to live in the October of that year but her daughter Ashleigh believes her mum was determined to spend one last Christmas with the family, reports Liverpool Echo.Lynn had been in Marie Curie Hospice in the weeks leading up to December , , but was allowed home on Christmas Eve to spend the festive period with her family. Ashleigh said it was a special time for her family and her mum also absolutely loved it. She said: My mum was always thinking of others before herself even though she was so ill, and she wanted to try and make Christmas as normal as possible. It was our tradition every year for myself, my mum and my brother to go to London at the beginning of December for the weekend.  My mum loved to go to Harrods and get her special presents from there. Obviously, she was too ill to go but she still wanted me to go and get everyone’s Christmas presents - she was ringing me from her bed at Marie Curie telling me what to buy from Harrods. “While she was staying at Marie Curie, we brought one of her Christmas trees in from home and decorated it and put all the presents we had bought underneath – we wanted her room to feel very homely. “Christmas was such a special time for our family as my mum absolutely loved it and looked forward to it all year. We enjoyed the build-up, doing Christmassy things and visiting the markets. Mum was too ill to go out to the Christmas markets, but Marie Curie had a special Christmas fayre in the hospice with stalls selling all types of things. All my family went along, and we really enjoyed it. It was perfect as it was all indoors, and we could easily push my mum in the wheelchair from her room and into the lt upstairs to visit the stalls.” Ashleigh added that her mum was allowed home on Christmas Eve, which meant the family could spend the night with eachother. We all stayed with mum on Christmas Eve and we opened our presents as normal on Christmas morning, Ashleigh said. After our Christmas lunch, my mum then fell asleep early afternoon and never really woke again apart from saying the odd sentences, and then she then passed away Boxing Day morning. I really do believe she got the strength to make sure she was there for the whole of Christmas Day. We were told in October that she only had days left to live but she fought on and I think once she was home, and saw us all together for one last Christmas, she was ready to go. Even though it was the worst time of our lives, we are so glad we got to spend that last Christmas together, and Marie Curie helped make that possible.” Lynn was a health care assistant at Alder Hey Childrenaposs Hospital and Ashleigh said due to this she trusted the doctors and nurses at Marie Curie and felt safe and secure at the hospice. Since Lynnaposs death, the family have raised raised thousands of pounds for Marie Curie. Ashleigh said: “At the funeral, we asked for donations to Marie Curie rather than flowers and after that, I thought that I’d like to do other things to raise money for the charity to give something back and do something for my mum and the whole family. “So, the first thing that we did was host charity night at a local social club with raffles, Irish Bingo and entertainment. We did a tombola too and got lots of prizes from dferent companies to auction for the raffle - it was amazing. We raised roughly £, from that event. “Then, when we took the money to Marie Curie and learnt about the Pay for a Day fundraising challenge where we could set ourselves the goal of raising enough money to pay to run the hospice for a whole day. So, we jumped at this and got on with planning our next event a charity walk. “It ended up being a fancy dress walk for family and friends mainly, starting at the Albert Dock and ending up at my mum’s house in Dovecot, where we had drinks to celebrate and toast mum. We walked over K and raised more than £,.” “We plan on doing more fundraising for Marie Curie in the future too.” Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON ChristmasBoxing DayHarrods Inc.Love IslandCharitiesFuneralsHospitalsStock marketFancy dressChristmas treesChristmas partyCancer" data-immediate"data-immediate"Join the Secret Elves for celebration inspiration - and brilliant gt ideas and reviewsSpread the cheer!Invalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. news uk-news uk-weather-forecast-brits-bask-"UK weather: Met Office issues yellow wind warningsByLauren DavidsonReporterDouglas Patient:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |comments Hot weather will see up to C in the UK next month after the Met Office warned of more wind and rain today. Weather forecaster Jim Dale told the Express that Brits can look forward to hot weather arriving fairly early this year. April temperatures in the UK usually reach a daily high of around C and a low of C - but the high this year could reach a scorching C, Daily Star reports.The forecaster said such spikes in temperature are becoming more likely as a result of global warming. He said: I think hot weather could come in fairly early as far as April is concerned perhaps.  I know March is the start of Spring but I think weaposre probably going to get properly into April before we start to see the searing sort of temperatures. I wouldnapost be surprised to see C, C, C in the middle of April. Dale added: Longer-term, given whataposs happening globally in terms of the temperature profiles in the southern hemisphere and whataposs also happening in the United States, I would not be surprisedwe started to see some big highlights - in whichever direction it goes, either cold or hot. It is more likely that we see those spikes of heat at early stages because of global warming. Itaposs too dficult to be certain at this moment, but I would not be surprised to see the summer deliver the same kind of heat stress at times. This comes as the Met Office issued yellow weather warnings for strong winds on Sunday.  Gusts are expected to track up the Irish Sea, and winds may reach  to mph along coastal areas. These are expected to travel northwards throughout Sunday. There is a small chance of winds exceeding mph, possibly reaching severe gales along more exposed coastal regions with winds reaching mph. This may lead to some poor coastal conditions and transport disruption.  UK  day weather forecastToday: Band of rain continuing north and east, becoming slow moving across parts of east and southeast England later. Sunshine and showers, heavy in places with hail and thunder, following across western areas. Gales in western areas easing through the afternoon. Tonight: Rain in east clearing. Showers near southern coasts,  clear spells inland allowing frost and patchy fog to form. Cloudier further north with outbreaks of rain in the northwest. Monday: Outbreaks of rain across the northwest moving east across northern areas and turning more showery. Sunny spells further south, with a few heavy showers developing. Outlook for Tuesday to Thursday: Rain across the far northwest on Tuesday will spread across many areas during Wednesday, before clearing to leave largely dry, fine, and sunny conditions by Thursday. title: uk weather forecast ferocious 70mph
story: UK weather forecast: Ferocious mph winds and rain to batter country this weekendThe Met Office has issued yellow warnings for wind this weekend with ferocious gusts and rain expected to batter the country before the sun arrives with C temperaturesPeople are being warned over strong winds this weekend Image: PA Archive PA ImagesByTim HanlonNews Reporter:,  Mar |commentsBrits are being warned of a blustery weekend with ferocious winds and rain driving into the South West and then spreading across the country on Sunday.The Met Office has issued yellow warnings for wind and rain on both Saturday and Sunday with an unsettled picture ahead before a much improved outlook for next week with sun and temperatures rising as high as C.But for the weekend there is likely to be a battering from the strong winds and plenty of rain.The Met Office weather warning covers the South West on Saturday and runs from pm until pm.It states: “A spell of windy and wet weather during Saturday afternoon may lead to some travel disruption.”  It says: “Some delays to road, rail, air and ferry transport are likely. Probably some bus and train services affected, with some journeys taking longer. “Delays for high-sided vehicles on exposed routes and bridges likely and damage to trees possible. Some short term loss of power and other services is possible. It’s likely that some coastal routes, sea fronts and coastal communities will be affected by spray and or large waves.” Then more widespread yellow warnings are also in place for Sunday with similar advice to expect travel disruption. BBC weather forecaster Tomasz Schafernaker warned people that as well as the strong wind people will need their umbrellas.“A lot of cloud and some rain across Scotland, parts of northern England, brighter across the rest of England and Wales, and in fact some decent sunny spells through the middle of the afternoon and I think the best of the weather will be the further east you go, he said, looking at Saturday.  But notice this curl of rain here, this is a low pressure that is swinging into the south west of the UK. Not only rain but some very strong winds, we are talking of gusts of mph, mph and maybe even mph so it is really going to be quite stormy around some of the coasts.” Mr Schafernaker said it is not widespread but advised people in the South West to take care. Then on Sunday the strong winds will cover the country with the weather impacted by a low pressure system by the west of Scotland. Very gusty winds right across the country, we are talking mph, mph or maybe mph around some exposed coasts … on Sunday it will be blustery right across the UK. Temperatures on Sunday typically between C and C so not as mild as it has been but mild enough, said Mr Schafernaker.  Looking ahead to next week and people can expect spring-like temperatures especially in the south. Monday a much better day, the winds will be lighter there will be some sunshine around, still some showers around northern parts of the country but in the south it really is an improving picture and that’s how it is going to be over the next few days into next week, said Mr Schafernaker. In fact in the south of the country temperatures could peak around C or C. So a mixed weekend but better the week ahead.” UK forecast for the next  days Turning wet and windy in the Southwest this afternoon. Today: Sunny spells and showers this morning, with parts of Scotland seeing some more persistent rain. Showers fading for many this afternoon when wet and windy weather with heavy rain coastal gales develops over southwest England and southwest Wales. Tonight: Early evening rain in the southwest moves slowly northeastwards to extend from western Scotland into northwest England, the Midlands and southern England by dawn. Windy, with gales in the west. Sunday: Early rain over parts of Scotland and England clears eastwards, clearing the far east late afternoon. Otherwise, sunny spells and showers. Windy with coastal gales in the north and west. Outlook for Monday to Wednesday: Occasionally unsettled across northern and western areas, with spells of rain and strong winds. Generally drier where, with some mist and fog overnight, before some rain develops Wednesday. news us-news meghan-markles-dad-thomas-vows-"Thomas Markle glad the truth is coming out about MeghanByPatrick HillNews Reporter:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar Meghan Markle ’s dad is launching his own YouTube channel.Thomas Markle Snr and close pal Karl Larsen have been inspired by straight-talking royal author Lady Colin Campbell and US podcast king Joe Rogan.They plan to broadcast their views on current affairs – which will no doubt include Meghan and Harry – every week.Thomas, , confirmed: “We have discovered YouTube… we’ve decided to join and share our story.” The first episode is set to go online tomorrow and will see Thomas give his views on his eldest daughter Samantha suing Meghan, , for defamation. Get all the latest news sent to your inbox.for the free Mirror newsletter  The lawsuit was first revealed by the Sunday Mirror in November and was formally lodged in Florida last week. Samantha, , is suing her half-sister Meghan for , , claiming she lied about her to the authors of controversial book Finding Freedom and in her TV interview with Oprah Winfrey. Speaking in the debut episode, Thomas says: “I’m standing up for my oldest daughter, Samantha. In this case, she should win because Meghan’s book was full of lies about her. I would appear in a deposition in this case,it came to it.”Michael Kump, representing Meghan, called the lawsuit “baseless and absurd” and a “continuation of a pattern of disturbing behaviour”. He added: “We will give [the lawsuit] the minimum attention necessary, which is all it deserves.” In November, Meghan apologised to the Court of Appeal after emails contradicting a claim she did not collaborate with Finding Freedom authors Omid Scobie and Carolyn Durand were disclosed. The messages, revealed by Meghan’s ex-communications secretary Jason Knauf, showed she sent details about Samantha and brother Thomas Jr to pass on for the book. But Meghan insisted: “I had absolutely no wish or intention to mislead the defendant or the court.”  Speaking about the motivation behind the podcast, Thomas’s co-host Karl, , said: “Tom wants to do it to put his thoughts out there from the horse’s mouth. He wants to speak about how Meghan and Harry have affected his family. The chat will be no-holds-barred. “He wants his truth to be out there, just like Meghan’s truth came out a year ago in her Oprah Winfrey interview.  “He also wants to speak about other things in the news, too.” Karl – an LA-based photographer who grew up in Winchester, Hants – added: “We’re thinking of referring to ourselves as ‘the yapper and the snapper’ in future. It sounds more catchy than Tom and Karl.” Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterMORE ON Prince HarryMeghan MarkleYouTubeRoyal FamilySunday Mirror" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get our daily royal round-up direct to your inboxInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. news weird-news balding-man-tears-new-hair-"Balding man in tears after age defying hair transformationBySofie JacksonVideo News ReporterEmma RosemurgeyAudience Writer:,  Mar |comments A man who had begun losing his hair has been left crying tears of joy after receiving a hair piece which makes him look  years younger.Ashley Tawney couldnapost keep his emotions to himself as he was filmed breaking down in tears after being fitted with the realistic hair system by Novo Cabelo Hair.The company filmed -view before and after shots on TikTok, leaving followers gobsmacked by Ashleyaposs incredible transformation, the Daily Star reports.In the clip, the voice over can be heard saying: He is tired of feeling self-conscious about his hair.Ashleyaposs eyes are covered so he canapost see stylist Rob working on the hair system, first shaving off unwanted hair, then covering his scalp with protector and adhesive. Rob then fits the hair system and begins styling it so it flows seamlessly into Ashleyaposs natural hair. All we needed was Ashleyaposs reaction – letaposs see what he thinks, the voice over says, as Ashley breaks down in tears, saying, Oh my god! He then examines his new hairstyle from every angle and looks like he is welling up with tears. The video was watched more than , times since it was uploaded on March , by @novocabelohair on TikTok and viewers were just as stunned.Tears in my eyes. People donapost realise this can really shatter some menaposs confidence. It doesnapost define you, but itaposs dficult to accept, one viewer said, while another added: Omg he looks  years younger! I think itaposs great that men can feel better... like women have been with wigs for years, a third wrote, while a fourth commented: What a genuine guy, I’m happy for him he looks amazing. Another TikTok user wrote: I’m a woman who unfortunately is going through my two-stage of hair loss in four years, it’s so upsetting, Ashley you look amazing. Ashley replied to the comments himself, writing: Iaposm so pleased with my new system! I love it! I honestly canapost thank you enough rob, makes me teary watching this! Selfie-taking non-stop. For most men, balding is a totally normal part of getting older butit seems unusual or is affecting your self-esteem you should speak to your GP.The NHS says male pattern hair loss can be treated with finasteride and minoxidil but they do not work for all men and can be expensive, as they are not available on prescription. Do you have a story to share  We want to hear all about it. title: gp receptionist shares rude things
story: GP receptionist shares rude things all callers say - and theyre very repetitiveA GP receptionist has spoken out about her job, saying what its like dealing with people day in day out who all say the same thing and get annoyed at her for doing her jobThe receptionist said they were asked the same questions all day long Image: Getty ImagesByJohn BettAudience Writer:,  Mar |comments A GP receptionist has revealed the rude and annoying things patients say when they call up - and theyaposre so common you might be guilty of them without realising.Weaposve all been there, on hold when you call up bang on the minute the surgery opens - ashundreds of people managed to beat you to it in the seconds it took your phone to connect. When you get through, you might be tempted to say how long youaposve been on hold, or ask how many people are answering the phones, but spare a thought for the poor receptionist. Sharing the story anonymously, the receptionist said that they get asked those questions constantly, and while the caller utters the words the hold queue continues to grow. What do you think about the call queues  Let us know in the comments...Sharing their story anonymously, the receptionist said the first question they dread is: God is there only one of you answering the phone  To which the woman replies: No there are around seven of us and we arenapost just sat around drinking tea. Another classic the receptionist shared was when people say: Finally, Iaposve been on hold for two hours. But she said: We can see how long youaposve been on hold and itaposs not two hours.  For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newslettershere. She also said that people get frustrated when they canapost speak to their GP immediately. The woman explained that some say: Why canapost you just put me through to the doctor  To which she replied: There are about  patients always waiting for a call back.She also said that some people tell her youaposre just a receptionist I want to speak to someone who knows what they are talking about, as The Sun reports. news weird-news i-thought-guy-dating-sweet-"TikToker put off by dates comments about her sex leByJohn BettAudience Writer:,  Mar |comments A woman was shocked after going on a date with a apossweetapos guy - as he implied she was an easy goer because she had children. Sharing her story on TikTok, Sammie Morrissey, , said that the man at first came across very well, offering to pay for food and going the extra mile to impress.But soon his demeanour changed, and he started getting rude with waiting staff - something that Sammie now recognises as a red flag. Then one day, after a date, he made a comment about her children that completely ruined the atmosphere, and now sheaposs describing the experience as one of the worse dates sheaposs been on. What do you think of the manaposs behaviour  Let us know in the comments... Sharing her story on TikTok, where she uploads as @sammiemorrissey, Sammie said: He seemed like a really sweet guy, he was very funny, he really laid it on thick the nice guy act.The second we sat down at the table, I started to get weird a*****e vibes. Sammie said that he got annoyed at waiters and complained about the restaurant, and she said: I was just really turned off by that, he had this weird negative energy about him and I didnapost really like that. I offered to pay. He would not let me do it which was nice of him.  Then, things went from bad to worse when they left the diner when she refused to go back to his place. She claims the man said: Look weaposre both adults here. I know that youaposre not exactly a virgin. You have a kid. That was enough for Sammie and she put an end to their romance and shared the story on TikTok for others to enjoy. She said: Man, he really got me enough on that first coffee date to meet him for dinner. Iaposve officially been on  first dates in the past two years.  For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newslettershere. Sammieaposs video had over , views alongside hundreds of comments. One said: Yeah that’s sad. I’m glad you are okay. Then another wrote: The aposnice guysapos are usually the ones you have to watch out for. A lot of the times they’ve learned what they think we want to hear. And a third wrote: I’m glad that you have boundaries you know what you want and what you deserve. Iaposm happy that you are safe.
